summary: This is a statutory declaration by William Patrick Cusack, a Queensland solicitor, describing his role as mentor/supervisor for a young lawyer (Anthony John Britt) from April/May 2016 to September/October 2017. The declaration details work on two major criminal cases (Orville Alfa Adriaan De Raadt and Raymond John Mead) and attests to Britt's full-time legal practice and professional conduct during that period.

persons.name: William Patrick Cusack
persons.context: Senior solicitor at GB Legal who acted as mentor/supervisor for Anthony John Britt from April/May 2016 to September/October 2017, providing oversight on major criminal cases.

persons.name: Alexander Andrew Tees
persons.context: Trading as GB Legal, employed both Cusack and Britt, and requested Cusack to mentor Britt on major criminal matters.

persons.name: Anthony John Britt
persons.context: The young lawyer being mentored by Cusack, who worked extensively on the De Raadt and Mead criminal cases, conducting prison visits, court appearances, and legal research.

persons.name: Orville Alfa Adriaan De Raadt
persons.context: Client of GB Legal facing charges of commercial drug trafficking; subject of a bail application and widespread newspaper publicity.

persons.name: David T. Cole
persons.context: Counsel from the bar at Southport briefed in the De Raadt matter.

persons.name: Raymond John Mead
persons.context: Client of GB Legal for an application for withdrawal of plea and appeal against conviction for murder and related matters.

persons.name: Allison Jane Robaldo
persons.context: Witnessed and certified the statutory declaration.

connections.description: Cusack acted as mentor/supervisor for Britt from April/May 2016 to September/October 2017, providing guidance on major criminal cases.
Cusack worked as a senior solicitor for Mr. Tees trading as GB Legal.
Britt was employed by Mr. Tees trading as GB Legal.
Britt worked on De Raadt's criminal case, including prison visits, bail application, and court appearances.
Britt worked on Mead's application for withdrawal of plea and appeal against murder conviction.
Cusack, along with Britt, briefed counsel David T. Cole in the De Raadt matter.

events.title: Cusack begins mentoring Britt
events.description: William Patrick Cusack agrees to act as mentor/supervisor for Anthony John Britt at the request of Alexander Tees, focusing on major criminal cases.

events.title: Work on De Raadt and Mead cases
events.description: Cusack and Britt work extensively on the Orville De Raadt drug trafficking case (bail application) and the Raymond Mead murder conviction appeal, including numerous prison visits, court appearances, and legal research.

events.title: Withdrawal from De Raadt matter
events.description: Cusack and Britt withdraw from representing De Raadt because the client and spouse did not honor their fee commitments.

events.title: Statutory declaration made
events.description: William Patrick Cusack makes this statutory declaration, witnessed by Allison Jane Robaldo, attesting to Britt's full-time legal practice and work from 2016-2018.

keyFacts: This document is a statutory declaration by solicitor William Patrick Cusack, intended to verify the full-time legal practice and professional work of Anthony John Britt from April/May 2016 to September/October 2017.
Cusack mentored Britt on two major criminal cases: the Orville Alfa Adriaan De Raadt drug trafficking case and the Raymond John Mead murder conviction appeal.
The declaration notes that both legal teams withdrew from the De Raadt and Mead matters due to clients not honoring fee commitments.
Cusack attests that Britt worked '24/7' to manage clients and cases throughout 2016-2018 and that over 600 emails were exchanged between them on these matters.
The document appears to be part of a professional verification or regulatory process concerning Anthony John Britt's legal practice history.
